snippet: The agency said it continued to suffer because of declining mail volume and a Congressional mandate requiring it to pay into a health fund for future retirees.
abstract: Financially troubled Postal Service posts net loss of $1.9 billion in second quarter, which ended March 31, compared with $1.3 billion loss in previous quarter.
lead_paragraph: The agency said it continued to suffer because of declining mail volume and a Congressional mandate requiring it to pay into a health fund for future retirees.

headline.seo: Postal Service Posts $1.9 Billion Loss in Second Quarter
